text:
“Why did you ring the bell?” Raskolnikov demanded. 

Porfiry smiled slyly. “You should have acted differently if you suspected me. I’d have searched your lodging.”

Raskolnikov flinched. “You’re lying! You didn’t speak like that before.”

“Am I lying?” Porfiry feigned shock. “I offered you a defense. Illness, delirium, melancholy. But why those delusions?”

Raskolnikov stood tall, contempt in his eyes. “Tell me, do you suspect me or not?”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Porfiry asserts that he has no suspicion of Raskolnikov, despite Raskolnikov's anxious behavior and accusations of deceit.
